Only the day before, someone murdered Minnie MaudeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Uncle Alf and made off with his rag-and-bones cartÃ¢â‚¬â€as well as with Charlie, the beloved donkey who pulled it. Now, Grace and Minnie Maude set off to rescue Charlie. But the path that Uncle Alf had taken to his death was not his regular route, and in his cart, the children are told, was a dazzling golden casket that could very well be a PandoraÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s box of evil or a shining prize of hope.
 
A CHRISTMAS ODYSSEY

WentworthÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s only hope, he believes, is his old friend Henry Rathbone, who volunteers to search for the wayward young man with the help of two new companionsÃ¢â‚¬â€Squeaky Robinson, a reformed brothel-keeper, and Crow, a mysterious slum doctor. As this odd trio gathers clues about LucienÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s disappearance on LondonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s dark streets, they find themselves on a mission whose outcome they cannot begin to guess. - Goodreads Summary
